newsitem.title: JAPAN: TEC shares ask-only on report of U.S. law suit.
newsitem.headline: TEC shares ask-only on report of U.S. law suit.

text.p: Shares in TEC Corp slipped on the Tokyo Stock Exchange on Friday morning on a newspaper report saying that the company's U.S. unit is being sued by a Michigan-based supermarket chain operator.
As of 0115 GMT, the shares were down 17 yen at 451.
The business daily Nihon Keizai Shimbun reported that the supermarket chain operator was seeking compensation of $10,000 for breakdowns of cash registers purchased from TEC's U.S. unit.
The paper said the registers failed due to the so-called millennium bug and could not read credit cards expiring in 2000.
Many computer systems cannot differentiate between the year 1900 and 2000 as only the last two digits are used in the system.
TEC officials were not immediately available to comment on the report.
TEC shares had been ask-only in early Friday morning trade as a result of the report.
